abstract:
We consider conforming finite element approximations of the time-dependent Oseen problem with inf–sup stable approximation
of velocity and pressure. The work serves as a preliminary study of the incompressible Navier–Stokes problem. In the case
of high Reynolds numbers, the local projection stabilization method is considered. In particular, the idea of streamline upwinding
is combined with stabilization of the divergence-free constraint. For the arising semidiscrete problem, a stability and convergence
analysis is given. Our approach improves some results of a recent paper by Matthies & Tobiska (2014, IMA J. Numer. Anal., 35, 239–269). Finally, we apply the approach to the time-dependent incompressible Navier–Stokes problem, test the accuracy of
the method and conduct numerical experiments with simple boundary layers and separation.
